result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter J Jacoby III

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
matter set for ptc 11/28/22 at 9:00
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
matter set for ptc 10/24/22 at 9:00
matter set for ptc 9/19/22 at 10:00
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by the State
/s/LJM 6-22-2022 - Approved - Judge Eagon.
Unsigned - proposed deferred entry of judgment agreement.

Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Peter J Jacoby III in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Peter J Jacoby III. 

9:27 AM Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present and would like to make a statement at the appropriate time.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Defendant will plead to Count 1, deferred entry of judgment agreement. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Court thanks victim for being present.
9:29 AM Victim addresses the Court, makes a statement.
Victim does not agree with the agreement.

Court questions Victim.
Victim is willing to go to trial and testify in front of a jury.

Court questions Atty Pfeil why the agreement was reached.
Atty Pfeil explains the agreement reached. State relied on the police report when making the offer, was not informed of the actions stated by the Victim.

Court addresses the parties.
Court states this is not appropriate to go forward with a deferred entry of judgment agreement.
Court does not agree and will not order.

Case will be reassigned to a new Judge.

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.

9:40 AM Court is in recess.
/s/ LJM 6/22/2022 - Approved.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Record Update
Filed by the State:  plea/sent set for 6/24/22 @ 9:30 am in Br 2
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Prosecutor.
Pre-trial conference on February 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:48 PM Defendant Peter J Jacoby in court with Attorney (Atty) Peter C Lloyd. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by Atty Peter Lloyd

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Peter Lloyd

Adjustment Number: 22A 006920,
Payable Number: 58789,
Amount: $20.00
Initial Appearance set for January 18, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 2

No contact with victim, A. R. S-G.
  May go to the premises one time, accompanied by law enforcement and arranged with the victim, to retrieve personal belongings.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule  appears in court for defendant. 
ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Victim is present but wishes to make no statement.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Taylor does not have any objections as to bond. 

BY THE COURT: Court sets bond.
